content.description: While probably not a destination on its own, added with other climbs in the area this should be on any Superstition aficionado's hitlist.  Crumbly rock and an extremely delicate step left (crux) to cross the mud/choss near the top will keep you on point.  Put on your ballet shoes and tip-toe your way up this beauty.
content.protection: One fixed bong.  Small to medium cams and tri-cams.  One original, one new bolt off summit.
content.location: The formation is easily seen from The Hand but can tend to blend into the wall (Defecation Wall) behind it.  The route begins on the east side.  You can just barely see the old bong in the crack up high from the base.

content.description: In the guidebook it is listed as a mud stack, they pretty much nailed that description!  Crowds will not be a problem but the rock may.
